page.title: 14BAYTREE FARM, POLEGATE
page.content: BAYTREE FARM IS ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF POLEGATE. IT COVERS 1.5 ACRES AND IS A POULTRY FARM SUPPLYING THE LOCAL AREA. DURING THE SECOND WORLD WAR IT WAS USED AS AN AIR BALLOON LANDING BASE. THE TYPE OF SOIL IS VERY HEAVY CLAY, THE LANDCOVER IS GRASS AND WEEDS WHICH IS VERY GOOD FOR GRAZING AND HAY. THE LIVESTOCK IS HENS AND THEY ARE BATTERY HENS.THEY ARE FED ON GRAIN WHICH IS BROUGHT FROM A SUPPLIER, THE GRAIN IS A BALANCED MEAL.THE WATER IS IN A SORT OF PUMP & WHEN PECKED, WATER COMES OUT.THEY DELIVER TO HOTELS , CAFES, CHINESE AND INDIAN RESTAURANTS. THEY DELIVER TO EASTBOURNE ,POLEGATE, ALFRISTON , UPPER DICKER , SEAFORD AND HEATHFIELD. WHEN THE SHEDS ARE FULL UP THERE ARE 22 THOUSAND CHICKENS.THERE'S A SHOP WHERE YOU CAN WALK IN AND BUY EGGS AND CHICKENS. THERE ARE THREE VANS DELIVER TO THE HOTELS etc.
